title: 3D Gradient Typeface ID
content:
Hello, anyone know this or something similar (or even a shadowed 3Dish typeface)

Very Display.

Hofe.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131010230317im_/http:/typophile.com/files/image_5544.jpg)

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [image.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20131010230317/http:/typophile.com/files/image_0.jpg) | 10.28 KB |
author: Höfe

comments.content: This was embossed in Photoshop. Check the way the lines merge sloppily on the crossbar of the E. Look at the curves on the rest of the E. When hunting for an embossed font, keep in mind that TrueType, Postscript and OpenType are limited to pure black and white - no gray except dots, lines etc.

Great, thanks..

I'm also liking the 3d (ish) look of Paul Barnes's Caslon Antique in Wallpaper. V. Nice.

You may want to take look at this plugin for Photoshop and Illustrator...

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131010230317im_/http:/typophile.com/files/path-styler-pro-sharp-bevel_4611.jpg)

[Path Styler Pro](http://web.archive.org/web/20131010230317/http:/www.shinycore.com/)
